text: John Wesley Russell (August 31, 1923 – December 24, 2012) was an American Republican politician who served two terms as mayor of Fairfax, Virginia, in the Fairfax City Council and one term in the Virginia Senate. He defeated legislative aide Emilie F. Miller to succeed her boss, Senator Abe Brault, in 1983, but he lost the seat in a rematch four years later. == References == == External links == * * Category:1923 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Politicians from Fairfax, Virginia Category:People from Madison County, Illinois Category:Virginia Republicans Category:Mayors of places in Virginia Category:Virginia city council members Category:Virginia state senators Category:20th-century American politicians Category:University of Illinois alumni Category:Southern Illinois University alumni Category:University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign alumni
title: John Russell (Virginia politician)
